meanings.definition: Obtain goods or services from an outside supplier.
meanings.sent1: Our company saves money by outsourcing customer service to a call center in another country.
meanings.sent2: Many businesses choose to outsource their IT support to specialized companies.
meanings.sent3: The small bakery decided to outsource their bread production to a local farm.
meanings.sent4: Outsourcing our marketing efforts to a professional agency has really boosted our sales.
meanings.sent5: Outsourcing production allows companies to focus on their core strengths and grow faster.

meanings.definition: Contract with an outside supplier to produce goods or services.
meanings.sent1: The company decided to outsource the manufacturing of their products to a factory overseas.
meanings.sent2: Outsourcing production can help businesses reduce costs and increase efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The toy company outsourced the design of their new line of toys to a talented artist.
meanings.sent4: By outsourcing the packaging of their products, the company was able to meet demand more effectively.
meanings.sent5: Outsourcing certain tasks can allow businesses to focus on innovation and growth.
